text:
Hello Nail, 

I think you may have not understood the task. I'll try my best to explain the task to you again. 

In Github, we have two types of issues - 

1. Open issues (e.g. - https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue)

2. Closed issues (e.g - https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed)

Open issues are those issues which are have been reported but may or may not have been solved. Open issues have a green "open" tag below the issue title. Open issues are quite important as they tell us what our product lacks.

Closed issues on the other hand are those which have been either resolved or are irrelevant to the project and hence are not that useful to us.

The task that you have taken up, requires you to classify open issues. You have to classify open issues as -

1. Open
2. In-progress
3. Closed

The criteria for classifying the issues have been mentioned in the task itself. You have to "only" classify open issues (issues with the green tag) and not closed issues (issues with the red tag). 

The sheet which you have shared with us contains closed issues, which is of no use to us. You have entered closed issues in the following cells - 

1. 23A
2. 19A

Can you please remove them and include only open issues in the sheet? 

For your reference, I am providing you with examples for each of the classifications mentioned in the task - 

1. Open (e.g - https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues/982)
2. In-progress (e.g - https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues/940)
3. Closed (e.g - https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues/835)

Please notice that all the issues mentioned above are open issues. 

Can you please make these changes and then get back to us?  :)

Also, if you have any difficulty in understanding the task please let us know. We'll help you out.

I'm really sorry for the delay in my response. Please excuse me.
task_definition_name: Mifos Android Client app - Organize GitHub Issues

text:
Hello Nail, 

You have to list only open issues in the sheet. You can find the list of all open issues here - 

https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues

From these issues, you have to classify issues as "open", "closed" or "in-progress"

You can classify an issue as "closed" if someone sent a pull request to that issue and the pull request for that issue got merged. 

Here's an example - 

https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues/716

Please notice that the issue mentioned above is still open and not closed. It has the green coloured "open" tag below the name of the issue. You have to include issues similar to the one mentioned above in the sheet.

You are not supposed to include closed issues in the sheet as they are either irrelevant or have been already resolved. Closed issues have a red coloured "closed" tag below the name of the issue. 

I have noticed that you have included 2 closed issues in the sheet. While adding issues to the sheet please make sure to only include those issues that are open, as we only want to classify open issues present in our GitHub repository.

The following cells have closed issues entered in them - 

1. 23A
2. 25A

Can you please remove these issues and add issues that are open?

Also, the colour code for the status of the issue mentioned in cell 10A is incorrect, it should be green, not blue.

The issue mentioned in the cell 20A is incorrectly classified. The status for the issue should be "in-progress" and not "open" as a pull request has already been sent for that issue. 

Can you please make these changes and then get back to us? Also, if you are unable to understand anything please let us know, we will help you out. :)

text:
Hello Nail,

While listing issues you only have to list those issues that are open, you don't have to include issues that have been closed. 

To put it more clearly, you only have to list "open issues" and not "closed issues".

You have entered a quite few "closed issues" in the sheet as well (e.g cell 37A, 36A, 35A,  32A, 26A, 25A, 24A, 21A, 20A, 16A, 15A, 13A, 12A, 7A, 6A, 4A). An "open issue" can be classified as closed if someone has sent a pull request and that pull request got merged. 

Here is an example - 
https://github.com/openMF/android-client/issues/835  

I noticed that you have also labelled a few issues incorrectly. Can you please change them as well? For the issues mentioned in cell 33A, 17A a pull request has already been sent, hence it's status should be "in=progress" (i.e "blue" and not "green")

Can you please make these changes and then get back to us? :)

text:
Hi Nail,

You haven't labelled the issues correctly. Note that the status isn't open if the PR is open. I'm taking the example of the first link (Issue #999) in the sheet you shared. There, the PR has been sent which is open (note again, the PR is open) which means that the issue falls in 'In progress' or Blue category. Let me know if you still have any confusion regarding labelling. 

Also, add a legend or texts with the background of the cell coloured with the label-colour to make it convenient for someone to understand.
